Package com.opengamma.strata.basics

Class CurrencyAmountAssert

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.assertj.core.api.AbstractAssert<CurrencyAmountAssert,​CurrencyAmount>
      • com.opengamma.strata.basics.CurrencyAmountAssert
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.assertj.core.api.Assert<CurrencyAmountAssert,​CurrencyAmount>, org.assertj.core.api.Descriptable<CurrencyAmountAssert>, org.assertj.core.api.ExtensionPoints<CurrencyAmountAssert,​CurrencyAmount>
    public class CurrencyAmountAssert
extends org.assertj.core.api.AbstractAssert<CurrencyAmountAssert,​CurrencyAmount>
    An assert helper that provides useful AssertJ assertion methods for CurrencyAmount instances.

    These allow {code CurrencyAmount}s to be inspected in tests in the same fluent style as other basic classes.

    So the following: 

       CurrencyAmount result = someMethodCall();
   assertEquals(result.getCurrency(), USD);
   assertEquals(result.getAmount(), 123.45, 1e-6);
    can be replaced with: 
       CurrencyAmount result = someMethodCall();
   assertThat(result)
     .hasCurrency(USD)
     .hasAmount(123.45, within(1e-6));
    or: 
       CurrencyAmount result = someMethodCall();
   CurrencyAmount expected = CurrencyAmount.of(USD, 123.45);
   assertThat(result).isEqualTo(expected, within(1e-6));

    In order to be able to use a statically imported assertThat() method for both CurrencyAmount and other types, statically import BasicProjectAssertions.assertThat(CurrencyAmount) rather than this class.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.assertj.core.api.AbstractAssert
